All rights reserved.\n3 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Continued on next page 2024: The Calm Before the Tariff Storm Welcome to Modern Distribution Management’s 2025 Top Distributors feature, now in its 16th year. Here, you’ll find our rankings of North America’s largest distributors of industrial, commercial and building supply products, based on their 2024 fiscal revenue within 20 different industry verticals. More than 200 different companies are represented across these various lists.\nIt’s MDM’s biggest research project of the year.\nBefore you dive into our rankings in the pages ahead, I want to set the stage for the key factors that shaped this year’s feature and the context you should know when perusing our lists.\nA One-Year “Normalcy” Reprieve Since our lists are based purely on 2024 fiscal revenue for all distributors, that year is worth examining from a high level.\nAfter riding the inflation wave in 2021 and 2022, distributors saw that tailwind weaken throughout 2023, and it was essentially a non-factor in 2024. Year-over-year comparables finally leveled off in 2024, and in a way, that made it feel like the first “normal” year for wholesale distribution financials for the first time since 2019 with no one single factor heavily influencing figures broadly.\nHeading into 2024, analysts had predicted a palpable industrial supply demand slowdown, and that forecast pushed further and further into the year and never really materialized aside from pockets of it. However, demand expectedly slowed in the fourth quarter as the U.S. general election loomed and President Trump’s election infused rampant economic uncertainty over how his administration’s trade policies would play out. 2025 has been anything but normal.\nU.S. wholesale distribution revenue finished at $8.076 trillion — a new annual record for the industry — up 2.0% compared with 2023. That’s not a gangbusters year by any means, and it trailed U.S. GDP annual growth of 2.8%, but it was within the long-run average of modest growth. Exemplifying distribution’s fragmentation and diversity, certain industry sectors saw excellent 2024 growth (electrical & electronics +11.4%; pharmaceutical +8.2%), while others saw considerable decline (agricultur-al -12.1%; metal service centers -10.1%). The vast majority of the distributors on our lists in the pages ahead posted annual sales gains in 2024, and tariff-driven market uncertainly led to inventory front-loading during 1Q25 as manufacturers and distribu-tors looked to stockpile goods before higher import levies took effect. As of mid-May, MDM expects overall, annual industry revenue to increase 3.3% in 2025, followed by stronger 4.6% growth in 2026.\nIndustry-Specific Revenue Like for the past several years, this is the most import-ant part of this introduction. Starting in 2022, MDM put a heightened emphasis on ranking companies by their sector-specific revenues rather than total revenue.\nThis also explains why you’ll see some distributors with smaller total revenues ranked higher than others within the same industry.\nTake Grainger, for example. By its total 2024 revenue of $17.2 billion, Grainger is North America’s largest indus-trial supplies distributor. But when digging into its finan-cial reports and product sector breakouts, we find that it’s also one of North America’s top distributors of electrical, HVACR, plumbing, power transmission, fluid power and safety products. This is why Grainger appears on 10 of our 20 sector lists — the company’s revenue within each of those segments is large enough to warrant a spot. And this is why Watsco is ranked No. 1 in HVACR and Grainger is No. 5. Despite Watsco’s $7.6 billion revenue being much smaller than Grainger’s — Watsco’s HVACR revenue was much higher than Grainger’s.\nThis explains why you’ll find some companies chart-ed on industry lists outside of their “core” offering. For example, Graybar is best known as an electrical products distributor, but its industrial products sales were large enough to chart at No. 14 on our Industrial Supplies list. It’s also why Ferguson appears on our lists for Industrial Supplies, Building Materials/Construction and Safety, besides its hallmarks of Plumbing, HVACR and Industrial PVF.\nBut while our rankings are based on 2024 revenue within each sector, the revenue you see displayed on our lists is overall revenue. Why? Quite simply, while many Source: MDM Forecast MDM Forecast: U.S. Wholesale Distribution Revenue by Year © 2025 Modern Distribution Management. All rights reserved.\n4 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Site licenses and multi-user pricing are available for those who wish to access Modern Distribution Management Premium content. Contact us for details at info@mdm.com, call (202) 872-0885 or visit our website at www.mdm.com.\nresearch Mike Hockett, Executive Editor Vesna Brajkovic, Senior Editor Tish Drake, SVP, MDM Portfolio Management Hadley Fable, VP, Operations MDM privately-owned distributors elected not to publicly share their total revenues, far fewer elected not to publicly share their sector-specific revenues. If we displayed the sector-specific revenues of those that gave us the OK to, they’d be few and far between. The overall revenue figure gives us something to show for the majority of companies on our lists.\nThat sector-specific revenue breakout is the most painstaking part of our research process, as it involves an incredible amount of hair-splitting and triangulation to find accurate revenues. It makes this feature all the more challenging, but we do it because it results in a more accu-rate list and levels the playing field.\nOur Research Process & Methodology MDM’s Top Distributors Lists were based on 2024 fiscal revenues within industry sectors, either reported or estimated by MDM’s editorial team and sector validators. For distributors that don’t follow a January-December fiscal calendar, we’ve noted that with an asterisk and a footnote. To normalize the way we display the rankings, we include total company revenues, rather than breaking out individual sector revenues. Companies were asked to provide data about revenue, with information sup-plemented by quarterly fiscal reports, SEC filings and publicly available information. For companies that elect to not share revenue data, MDM estimates their relative po-sition in its sector list based on the best available industry resources and information. Note: Companies that operate primarily as master distributors are not eligible for Top Distributors inclusion.\nTwo Core Lists Expanded With the help of our key validation sources and sup-port from MDM’s integration into the National Associa-tion of Wholesaler-Distributors, we were able to expand two of our biggest lists — Electrical/Data/Security and Building Materials/Construction — showing a larger rep-resentation of those sectors than ever before. Electrical/ Data/Security now shows the top 40 companies (up from 30 in 2024) and Building Materials/Construction numbers out to 20 (up from 15 in 2024).\nWhere's Amazon Business?\nMDM readers who have regularly seen our Top Distributors lists over the years may notice that we don’t include the industry’s biggest elephant in the room: Amazon Business. The B2B supplies marketplace appeared in the top six of our Top Industrial list since first appearing in 2018, including at No. 2 in 2022. But while the platform is certainly competing directly with indus-trial, commercial and building supply distributors for market share to a tune of $35 billion in 2022 revenue, we made the decision in 2023 to omit it from our lists due to Amazon Business’ very unique business model. It was the only company on our lists in previous years that couldn’t be described as a distributor. We do, however, include The Home Depot’s Pro component, which directly operates via distribution sales, services and logistics. To Keep in Mind As you peruse our rankings across these different verticals, it’s important to remember that the way we put them together is not an exact science. Our editorial team made every effort to extract revenue information from the non-publicly-traded distributors listed here, but many companies are understandably private with that information. We are happy to keep their revenue strictly private and only use it internally for rankings, which a number of companies opt for each year. So, when you see “N/A” listed for revenue, that likely means that revenue figure was confidentially given to MDM and to not be published.\nEven with that understanding, a smaller number of companies would rather not budge on sharing their revenue at all. Given the amount of large distributors that have been privately-acquired in recent years, this isn’t a surprise. In these cases where revenue isn’t shared, our team triangulates with respected industry experts and the best available information to estimate and rank distribu-tors appropriately.\nAnother nugget to note is that since we used fiscal 2024 revenue for all companies, the revenue of a handful of companies that don’t follow a traditional 12-month fiscal calendar represent a time difference by as much as nine months. We’ve denoted distributors that don’t follow a traditional fiscal calendar with an asterisk next to their revenue and a footnote for that.\nQuestions? Comments?\nAs alluded to above, there is no perfect way to conduct these rankings. I’m sure there are MDM readers who will disagree with where and how certain companies are slotted on our list, and that’s OK, especially given our focus on sector-specific revenue. I’m very open to comments and suggestions for how we can improve this feature going forward. Don’t hesitate to reach out.\nMike Hockett Executive Editor Modern Distribution Management © 2025 Modern Distribution Management. Fast forward one year, and the 2023 numbers are in: did distributors fare as well?\n\n**WATCH OUR BIG 50 COUNTDOWN VIDEOS: [Part 1: 50-31](https://www.inddist.com/video/video/22921172/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-5031), [Part 2: 30-11](https://www.inddist.com/video/video/22921285/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-3011), [Part 3: 10-1](https://www.inddist.com/big-50/video/22921433/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-the-top-10)**\n\nIt’s clear that the Big 50 List this year, in which we rank industrial distributors based on their 2023 performances, is a bit more varied. Many maneuvered through uneven end markets: costs continued to rise, while customers reached a breaking point on price increases.\n\nThe escalator may have stopped, but there was still a set of stairs to climb. We saw many companies incrementally grow, with a few who actually blew 2022 out of the water. Perhaps most importantly, we saw just a handful of them go backwards.\n\nTellingly, the companies on our Big 50 List are moving forward despite any short-term roadblocks they may have encountered last year. Instead of retreating with the soft categories that supported them, we heard from many a story of growth: heavy acquisition activity, product line expansions, new branches, executive hires – all the things that change the tenor to create the exact right kind of “humming along” for each business.\n\nAlthough many saw big years without major acquisitions, dozens of other distributors on this year’s list have also been active on the mergers and acquisitions front — with some exciting developments that will alter the shape of Big 50 lists to come.\n\nPresenting the 2024 Industrial Distribution Big 50:\n\n| **The 2024 *Industrial Distribution*****Big 50** | | | | | | |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n|  |  |  | **2023 Sales** | **Top Executive** |  |  |\n|  | [W.W. People and strategy count too.\n\n**[Continue Reading](../resources/thought_leadership/thought_leadership_articles/strengthen_supply_chain_1.php \"Continue Reading\")**\n\nEngineering Assistance\n\nOur engineering team will evaluate your new product design and recommend the right product for both the material and the application.\n\n**[Continue Reading](../resources/thought_leadership/thought_leadership_articles/wurth_engineering.php \"Continue Reading\")**\n\nSupply Chain Solutions\n\nAs the world’s largest industrial distributor, we customize your inventory management to handle every facet of your inventory.\n\n**[Continue Reading](../solutions/Solutions.php \"Continue Reading\")**\n\n---\n\n---\n\n## DOWNLOAD QUICK RESOURCES\n\n**Supplier Line Card**\n\nSee our products, solutions, and supplier brands that make us the #1 industrial distributor in the world.\n\n**[Download](../../../media/downloads/marketing_library/hubspot_import/WINA_Supplier_Line_Card_8_5x11_Digital.pdf \"Download\")**\n\n**Common Fastener & Hardware Abbreviations**\n\nIncrease your knowledge and make ordering faster with this reference.\n\n**[Download](../../../media/downloads/marketing_library/hubspot_import/Common_Fastener_and_Hardware_Abbreviations.pdf \"Download\")**\n\n**Capabilities Brochure**\n\nWe’re on the cutting edge of innovative technology, solutions, and parts management.\n\n**[Download](../../../media/downloads/marketing_library/hubspot_import/Capabilities_Brochure_Spread_2020_v2.pdf \"Download\")**\n\nWe provide you with maximum efficiency, control, and transparency. Würth's highly customized [logistics solutions](../solutions/inventory_management/Inventory_management.php \"logistics solutions\") lower your purchasing and operating costs, save valuable storage space, and free up your teams so you can concentrate on your core business. Our responsive, experienced team provides constant support to ensure you get the most out of your programs and products.\n\nOur parent company, the [Würth Group](../about_us/wurth_group_affiliation/wurth_group_affiliation.php \"Würth Group\"), is the world market leader in industrial distribution and consists of hundreds of companies in more than 80 countries. Our access to the Würth Group's global knowledge and resources provides us with a network of stability and a breadth of expertise. At the same time, our local teams cultivate personal relationships and understanding to ensure that your business’s supply chain needs are met.\n\nFamily owned and privately held since 1945, the Würth Group is characterized by a future-oriented strategy, unparalleled customer partnership, and an unrivaled commitment to quality.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n  \n\n\n* [LOCATIONS](../about_us/locations/branches.php \"Locations\")\n* [CONTACT US](../contact/contact.php \"Contact Us\")", "images": []}, {"url": "https://www.mrcglobal.com/", "raw_content": "Announcing IMTEC Services JV for Gas Utility Customers\n\n· Providing a full suite of integrated smart meter technical services· Applying for certification as woman-owned business\n\nTRUSTED. EXPERIENCED.\n\n2500+\n\nTeam Members\n\n$2.9B\n\nSales\n\n7100+\n\nSuppliers\n\n8300+\n\nCustomers\n\n104\n\nYears of Experience\n\n15\n\nCountries of Operation\n\n197\n\nLocations Worldwide\n\n$757M\n\nGlobal Inventory\n\nHydro\n\nMRC Global supplied pipes, valves and fittings (PVF) to the largest committed renewable energy project in Australia, which links two existing dams and will provide on-demand power while reusing or “recycling” water in a closed loop to maximize efficiency of renewables by using excess solar and wind energy to pump water to the higher dam to be stored for future use.\n\nEnsuring Energy Security & Accelerating Energy Transition\n\nEnergy security is more important than ever. Investments in green energy and decarbonization projects are on the rise. Learn how MRC Global is supporting our customers in these endeavors.\n\nGas Utilities\n\nAs North America’s leading distributor of gas materials, MRC Global’s experience in the gas utilities space is unmatched. We deliver products and services that provide safe and reliable energy to millions of homes and businesses.\n\nDownstream and Industrial\n\nCritical process applications like those found in the downstream and industrial sectors demand the most reliable products, a high degree of product knowledge and on-site technical expertise. With our quality-tested materials and advanced technical support, MRC Global delivers experience you can trust for turnarounds, major capital projects, and MRO.\n\nProduction and Transmission Infrastructure\n\nOur customers in the Production and Transmission Infrastructure industry play an essential role in maintaining energy security through safe production and transportation of oil and gas. MRC Global provides the footprint, services and reliable products required to safely and efficiently move oil and gas into gathering systems and pipelines.\n\nOffshore Wind\n\nMRC Global has been awarded contracts to provide the complete scope of valves, instrumentation, piping, tubing and fittings for an offshore wind power project located off the coast of New York.\n\nCarbon Capture\n\nMRC Global supplied valves to a project in Belgium, which will capture carbon-rich process gases from a blast furnace and biologically convert them to bioethanol. It is expected to produce 80 million liters of bioethanol annually.\n\nHydrogen\n\nMRC Global provided pipes, valves and fittings (PVF) in Alberta for a world-scale blue-hydrogen plant. The facility is expected to begin net-zero hydrogen production and liquefaction in 2024.\n\nBiofuels\n\nMRC Global supplied pipe, valves and fittings (PVF) to a major U.S. refining company’s conversion of its refinery to a renewable fuels facility in California. This facility is expected to produce approximately 730 million gallons a year of lower carbon-intensity renewable fuels.\n\nGeothermal\n\nMRC Global provided automated valve assemblies for a geothermal pilot plant in California. The completed installation includes four geothermal heat power generation units with capacity between 600 KW and 1.35 MW.\n\nHydro\n\nMRC Global supplied pipes, valves and fittings (PVF) to the largest committed renewable energy project in Australia, which links two existing dams and will provide on-demand power while reusing or “recycling” water in a closed loop to maximize efficiency of renewables by using excess solar and wind energy to pump water to the higher dam to be stored for future use.\n\nEnsuring Energy Security & Accelerating Energy Transition\n\nEnergy security is more important than ever. Investments in green energy and decarbonization projects are on the rise. Learn how MRC Global is supporting our customers in these endeavors.\n\n1 of 10\n\nGlobal Reach\n\nOperating from nearly 200 locations worldwide, MRC Global distributes PVF products to customer operations around the globe. each sector. Please send updates/corrections to editor@mdm.com.\n© 2025 Modern Distribution Management. All rights reserved.\n3 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Continued on next page 2024: The Calm Before the Tariff Storm Welcome to Modern Distribution Management’s 2025 Top Distributors feature, now in its 16th year. Here, you’ll find our rankings of North America’s largest distributors of industrial, commercial and building supply products, based on their 2024 fiscal revenue within 20 different industry verticals. More than 200 different companies are represented across these various lists.\nIt’s MDM’s biggest research project of the year.\nBefore you dive into our rankings in the pages ahead, I want to set the stage for the key factors that shaped this year’s feature and the context you should know when perusing our lists.\nA One-Year “Normalcy” Reprieve Since our lists are based purely on 2024 fiscal revenue for all distributors, that year is worth examining from a high level.\nAfter riding the inflation wave in 2021 and 2022, distributors saw that tailwind weaken throughout 2023, and it was essentially a non-factor in 2024. Year-over-year comparables finally leveled off in 2024, and in a way, that made it feel like the first “normal” year for wholesale distribution financials for the first time since 2019 with no one single factor heavily influencing figures broadly.\nHeading into 2024, analysts had predicted a palpable industrial supply demand slowdown, and that forecast pushed further and further into the year and never really materialized aside from pockets of it. However, demand expectedly slowed in the fourth quarter as the U.S. general election loomed and President Trump’s election infused rampant economic uncertainty over how his administration’s trade policies would play out. 2025 has been anything but normal.\nU.S. wholesale distribution revenue finished at $8.076 trillion — a new annual record for the industry — up 2.0% compared with 2023. That’s not a gangbusters year by any means, and it trailed U.S. GDP annual growth of 2.8%, but it was within the long-run average of modest growth. Exemplifying distribution’s fragmentation and diversity, certain industry sectors saw excellent 2024 growth (electrical & electronics +11.4%; pharmaceutical +8.2%), while others saw considerable decline (agricultur-al -12.1%; metal service centers -10.1%). The vast majority of the distributors on our lists in the pages ahead posted annual sales gains in 2024, and tariff-driven market uncertainly led to inventory front-loading during 1Q25 as manufacturers and distribu-tors looked to stockpile goods before higher import levies took effect. As of mid-May, MDM expects overall, annual industry revenue to increase 3.3% in 2025, followed by stronger 4.6% growth in 2026.\nIndustry-Specific Revenue Like for the past several years, this is the most import-ant part of this introduction. Starting in 2022, MDM put a heightened emphasis on ranking companies by their sector-specific revenues rather than total revenue.\nThis also explains why you’ll see some distributors with smaller total revenues ranked higher than others within the same industry.\nTake Grainger, for example. By its total 2024 revenue of $17.2 billion, Grainger is North America’s largest indus-trial supplies distributor. But when digging into its finan-cial reports and product sector breakouts, we find that it’s also one of North America’s top distributors of electrical, HVACR, plumbing, power transmission, fluid power and safety products. This is why Grainger appears on 10 of our 20 sector lists — the company’s revenue within each of those segments is large enough to warrant a spot. And this is why Watsco is ranked No. 1 in HVACR and Grainger is No. 5. Despite Watsco’s $7.6 billion revenue being much smaller than Grainger’s — Watsco’s HVACR revenue was much higher than Grainger’s.\nThis explains why you’ll find some companies chart-ed on industry lists outside of their “core” offering. For example, Graybar is best known as an electrical products distributor, but its industrial products sales were large enough to chart at No. 14 on our Industrial Supplies list. It’s also why Ferguson appears on our lists for Industrial Supplies, Building Materials/Construction and Safety, besides its hallmarks of Plumbing, HVACR and Industrial PVF.\nBut while our rankings are based on 2024 revenue within each sector, the revenue you see displayed on our lists is overall revenue. Why? Quite simply, while many Source: MDM Forecast MDM Forecast: U.S. Wholesale Distribution Revenue by Year © 2025 Modern Distribution Management. All rights reserved.\n4 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Site licenses and multi-user pricing are available for those who wish to access Modern Distribution Management Premium content. Contact us for details at info@mdm.com, call (202) 872-0885 or visit our website at www.mdm.com.\nresearch Mike Hockett, Executive Editor Vesna Brajkovic, Senior Editor Tish Drake, SVP, MDM Portfolio Management Hadley Fable, VP, Operations MDM privately-owned distributors elected not to publicly share their total revenues, far fewer elected not to publicly share their sector-specific revenues. If we displayed the sector-specific revenues of those that gave us the OK to, they’d be few and far between. The overall revenue figure gives us something to show for the majority of companies on our lists.\nThat sector-specific revenue breakout is the most painstaking part of our research process, as it involves an incredible amount of hair-splitting and triangulation to find accurate revenues. It makes this feature all the more challenging, but we do it because it results in a more accu-rate list and levels the playing field.\nOur Research Process & Methodology MDM’s Top Distributors Lists were based on 2024 fiscal revenues within industry sectors, either reported or estimated by MDM’s editorial team and sector validators. For distributors that don’t follow a January-December fiscal calendar, we’ve noted that with an asterisk and a footnote. To normalize the way we display the rankings, we include total company revenues, rather than breaking out individual sector revenues. Companies were asked to provide data about revenue, with information sup-plemented by quarterly fiscal reports, SEC filings and publicly available information. For companies that elect to not share revenue data, MDM estimates their relative po-sition in its sector list based on the best available industry resources and information. Note: Companies that operate primarily as master distributors are not eligible for Top Distributors inclusion.\nTwo Core Lists Expanded With the help of our key validation sources and sup-port from MDM’s integration into the National Associa-tion of Wholesaler-Distributors, we were able to expand two of our biggest lists — Electrical/Data/Security and Building Materials/Construction — showing a larger rep-resentation of those sectors than ever before. Electrical/ Data/Security now shows the top 40 companies (up from 30 in 2024) and Building Materials/Construction numbers out to 20 (up from 15 in 2024).\nWhere's Amazon Business?\nMDM readers who have regularly seen our Top Distributors lists over the years may notice that we don’t include the industry’s biggest elephant in the room: Amazon Business. The B2B supplies marketplace appeared in the top six of our Top Industrial list since first appearing in 2018, including at No. 2 in 2022. But while the platform is certainly competing directly with indus-trial, commercial and building supply distributors for market share to a tune of $35 billion in 2022 revenue, we made the decision in 2023 to omit it from our lists due to Amazon Business’ very unique business model. It was the only company on our lists in previous years that couldn’t be described as a distributor. We do, however, include The Home Depot’s Pro component, which directly operates via distribution sales, services and logistics. To Keep in Mind As you peruse our rankings across these different verticals, it’s important to remember that the way we put them together is not an exact science. Our editorial team made every effort to extract revenue information from the non-publicly-traded distributors listed here, but many companies are understandably private with that information. We are happy to keep their revenue strictly private and only use it internally for rankings, which a number of companies opt for each year. So, when you see “N/A” listed for revenue, that likely means that revenue figure was confidentially given to MDM and to not be published.\nEven with that understanding, a smaller number of companies would rather not budge on sharing their revenue at all. Given the amount of large distributors that have been privately-acquired in recent years, this isn’t a surprise. In these cases where revenue isn’t shared, our team triangulates with respected industry experts and the best available information to estimate and rank distribu-tors appropriately.\nAnother nugget to note is that since we used fiscal 2024 revenue for all companies, the revenue of a handful of companies that don’t follow a traditional 12-month fiscal calendar represent a time difference by as much as nine months. We’ve denoted distributors that don’t follow a traditional fiscal calendar with an asterisk next to their revenue and a footnote for that.\nQuestions? Comments?\nAs alluded to above, there is no perfect way to conduct these rankings. I’m sure there are MDM readers who will disagree with where and how certain companies are slotted on our list, and that’s OK, especially given our focus on sector-specific revenue. I’m very open to comments and suggestions for how we can improve this feature going forward. Grainger, Inc.  36 \n\nBasis of presentation: \n\nThe Company has a controlling ownership interest in MonotaRO , which is part of our Endless Assortment segment. MonotaRO’s results are fully consolidated, reflected in U.S. GAAP, and reported one -month in arrears. Results will differ \n\nfrom MonotaRO’s externally reported financials which follow Japanese GAAP. \n\nNon -GAAP financial measures: \n\nThe Company believes these non -GAAP financial measures provide meaningful information to assist investors in understanding finan cial results and assessing future performance as they provide a better baseline for analyzing the \n\nongoing performance of its business by excluding items that may not be indicative of core operating results. \n\n“Adjusted gross profit\", \"adjusted SG&A\", \"adjusted operating earnings\", “adjusted EBITDA”, \"adjusted net earnings\", \"adjuste d E PS (diluted)” — exclude certain non -recurring items, like restructuring charges, asset \n\nimpairments, gains and losses associated with business divestitures and other non -recurring, infrequent or unusual gains and los ses (together referred to as “non -GAAP adjustments”), from the Company’s most directly comparable \n\nreported U.S. GAAP figures (reported gross profit, SG&A, operating earnings, net earnings and EPS). The Company believes these non -GAAP adjustments provide meaningful information to assist investors in understanding financial \n\nresults and assessing future performance as they provide a better baseline for analyzing the ongoing performance of its busin ess by excluding items that may not be indicative of core operating results. \n\n\"Adjusted return on invested capital\" (ROIC) — is calculated using the Company's annualized adjusted operating earnings (defined above) divided by average net working asset s for the period. Average net working assets is calculated \n\nusing a two -point average for Q1, a three -point average for Q2, a four -point average for Q3 and a five -point average for Q4. Net working assets are working assets minus working liabilities and defined as follows: working assets equal \n\ntotal assets less cash and cash equivalents, deferred and prepaid income taxes and operating & finance lease right -of -use assets plus any LIFO reserves. Working liabilities are the sum of trade payables, accrued compensation and \n\nbenefits, accrued contributions to employees’ retirement savings plans and accrued expenses less current operating & finance lea se liabilities. The Company believes the presentation of adjusted ROIC provides useful information \n\nregarding how effectively the Company is using capital to generate financial returns. \n\n\"Free cash flow\" (FCF) — is calculated using total cash provided by operating activities less capital expenditures. The Company believes the presentat ion of FCF allows investors to evaluate the capacity of the Company's operations to \n\ngenerate free cash flow. \n\n\"Net leverage ratio\" — is calculated by dividing the Company’s net debt (total debt outstanding less debt issuance costs less cash and cash equivale nts) by adjusted EBITDA. Adjusted EBITDA is defined as EBITDA less the Company's \n\nnon -GAAP adjustments for the last twelve months. The Company believes the presentation of its net debt to adjusted EBITDA ratio provides useful information regarding the Company's liquidity and leverage. \n\n“Daily sales” — refers to net sales for the period divided by the number of U.S. selling days for the period. \n\n“Daily, constant currency sales” — refers to the daily sales adjusted for changes in foreign currency exchange rates. \n\n“Daily, constant currency sales in local days” — refers to daily sales adjusted for changes in foreign currency exchange rates and local selling days for the business unit. \n\n“Daily, organic sales” — refers to daily sales excluding the net sales of certain divested businesses in the comparable prior year period post date of divestiture. \n\n“Daily, organic constant currency sales” — refers to daily sales excluding the sales of certain divested businesses in the comparable prior year period post date of div estiture and changes in foreign currency exchange rates. \n\n“Daily, organic constant currency sales in local days” — refers to daily sales excluding the net sales of certain divested businesses in the comparable prior year period post date of divestiture, changes in foreign currency exchange \n\nrates and local selling days for the business unit. \n\n“Foreign currency exchange” — impact is calculated by dividing current period local currency daily sales by current period average exchange rate and subtra cting the current period local currency daily sales divided by the prior period \n\naverage exchange rate. \n\n“Volume outgrowth” — measured as High -Touch Solutions - U.S. daily, organic sales growth excluding price/customer mix contribution, less the estima ted U.S. MRO market volume which uses IP - NAICS Manufacturing sub -index as \n\nits primary input .\n\nU.S. selling days: \n\n2024: Q1 -64, Q2 -64, Q3 -64, Q4 -64, FY -256 \n\n2025: Q1 -63, Q2 -64, Q3 -64, Q4 -64, FY -255 \n\n2026: Q1 -63, Q2 -64, Q3 -64, Q4 -64, FY -255 © 2025 W.W. Categories](/products/categories)\n\n## Motion: North America’s Premier Industrial Distributor\n\nThe story begins in 1946, the year following the end of World War II, when two friends, a U.S. Marine Corps veteran and a U.S. Navy veteran, bought the industrial parts supply business Owen-Richards and opened the first location in Birmingham, Alabama. Though the company started as Owen-Richards in 1946, William Spencer and Caldwell Marks renamed the company “Motion Industries” in 1970. The name conveyed the purpose of keeping machinery – and industry – in motion.\n\nMany decades later Motion now operates both in the MRO (maintenance repair and operating) replacement parts market as well as the OEM market (original equipment manufacturer or equipment and machinery). Our organization’s unmatched experience with industrial parts and conveyance solutions positions us as an industrial and commercial partner, rather than a vendor or part supplier like other providers. We pride ourselves in keeping our partners’ jobsites and assembly lines running safe, smooth, and at maximum efficiency.\n\nMotion’s advanced automation solutions and engineering capabilities combined with our supply chain proficiency enable us to deliver superior results and satisfy a wide range of industrial, commercial, architectural, and engineering needs. Our value-added services, unparalleled customer service, and vast distribution network set us as the gold standard for industrial solutions.\n\n## Recommended For You\n\nNo Recommendation Found\n\nYour recommendations will appear here\n\n## Explore Our Offerings\n\n### More Industries\n\nWe understand the importance of reliable industrial supplies across all sectors. No matter the industry you serve, our top priority is getting you the quality products you need when you need them.\n\n[Shop by Industry](/cms/industries)\n\n### More Solutions\n\nMotion is the premier industrial solutions company for industry due to our superior customer service, value-added services, and vast inventory. We provide a myriad of solutions including on-site, repair, automation, conveyance, and more.\n\n[Discover More About Us](/cms/about-us)\n\n### More Safety\n\nFor industrial-grade safety products from top brands, browse Motion’s collection of protective equipment, first aid products, braces, supports, anti-slip tape, treads, and more.\n\n[Shop Safety](/products/Safety)\n\n## Shop Trusted Brands\n\n[Shop by Brand](/products/brand-list)\n\n## DISCOVER WATER TREATMENT\n\nSOLUTIONS\n\n[Shop Now](/cms/industry/waterworks)\n\n## HIGH-QUALITY PRODUCTS\n\nUNMATCHED SERVICE\n\n[Shop Now](/products/brands/skf)\n\nThis website uses cookies and other tracking technologies to enhance user experience, to display personalized advertisements and to analyze performance and traffic on our website. We also share information about your use of our site with our social media, advertising and analytics partners. You can find out additional information by clicking the Cookie Categories Button.\n\n## Cookie Privacy Center\n\nWhen you visit our website, we store cookies on your browser to collect information. The information collected might relate to you, your preferences or your device, and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to and to provide a more personalized web experience. Click on the different category headings to learn about the different categories of cookies we collect.\n\n### Manage Consent Preferences\n\n#### Strictly Necessary Cookies\n\nThese cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.    You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.\n\n#### Functional Cookies\n\nThese cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.    If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.\n\n#### Targeting Cookies\n\nThese cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.    They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.\n\n#### Performance Cookies\n\nThese cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site.    All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.", "images": []}, {"url": "https://www.motion.com/cms/about-us", "raw_content": "# ABOUT MOTION\n\nSince its beginnings in 1946, Motion has grown to become the premier industrial solutions company for industry in North America. Here's why:\n\n# ABOUT MOTION\n\nSince its beginnings in 1946, Motion has grown to become the premier industrial solutions company for industry in North America. Here's why:\n\n## Superior Customer Service\n\nOur employees reflect our company's values: fair, ethical, inclusive, and invested. We make sure customers receive the parts they need, when they need them.\n\n## VALUE-ADDED SERVICES\n\nFrom automation to inventory management to parts repair and fabrication, Motion's many services are key to keeping our customers' sites running at maximum efficiency. Our employees use their deep knowledge to bring the right solution to any and every application, no matter how challenging.\n\n## $1 BILLION INVENTORY\n\nOur customers have instant access to more than 18 million unique MRO/OEM parts through our vast distribution network, sourced from a global manufacturing base. Our broad and deep inventories offer known, quality brands.\n\n## Industries we serve\n\n[Aggregate & Cement\n\n### Aggregate & Cement\n\nWe have the parts from bearings to power transmission and fluid power components to help you successfully operate in one of the most remote, rugged, and dirtiest of industries.](/cms/industry/aggregate-cement)[### Automotive\n\nOur parts and services, from gearing and linear actuators to robotics and automated solutions, help this competitive industry remain flexible as it keeps pace with evolving regulations.](/cms/industry/automotive)[Chemical & Allied Products\n\n### Chemical & Allied Products\n\nWe have the parts necessary for safe and efficient production in this highly regulated industry, from lubricants and sealants to personal protective equipment.](/cms/industry/chemical-allied-products)[Data Center\n\n### Data Center\n\nWe offer solutions for power management, advanced cooling, reliable cabling, sturdy racks, and predictive monitoring tools.](/cms/industry/data-center)[Equipment & Machinery\n\n### Equipment & Machinery\n\nWe provide the parts from bearings to electrical motors to process pumps to keep in motion the equipment that operates the processing, transportation, packaging, and distribution of industrial goods.](/cms/industry/equipment-machinery)[Equipment Rental & Leasing\n\n### Equipment Rental & Leasing\n\nWe have the parts from hose to hydraulic pumps to pneumatic valves to keep your industrial machinery and rental equipment operating efficiently.](/cms/industry/equipment-rental-leasing)[Fabricated Metals\n\n### Fabricated Metals\n\nFrom conveyors to gearboxes to personal protective equipment, we’ve got you covered in the fast-paced, hot, and dusty environment of this industry.](/cms/industry/fabricated-metals)[Food & Beverage\n\n### Food & Beverage\n\nWe provide everything from conveying solutions to bearings to food-grade lubricants to comply with this highly regulated industry’s strict hygiene, precision, and automation needs.](/cms/industry/food-beverage)[Fulfillment and Distribution Centers\n\n### Fulfillment and Distribution Centers\n\nExplore innovative and durable solutions designed to optimize your distribution and fulfillment operations, helping you maximize efficiency, minimize downtime, and lower costs in even the most demanding environments.](/cms/industry/fulfillment-and-distribution-centers)[Government\n\n### Government\n\nOur comprehensive solutions for the government sector are designed to ensure reliable performance and optimal efficiency, even in the most challenging and rugged environments.](/cms/industry/government)[Iron & Steel\n\n### Iron & Steel\n\nWe offer bearings, couplings, gear reducers, fluid power systems, material handling components, power tools and industrial supplies that perform in this industry’s brutal conditions such as extreme heat, dust, and water ingress.](/cms/industry/iron-steel)[Lumber & Wood\n\n### Lumber & Wood\n\nFrom hydraulic cylinders to bearings to industrial chain, our parts have the durability to handle the impact, vibration, torque and strength requirements of loading logs, debarking, sawing, and processing lumber.](/cms/industry/lumber-wood)[Oil & Gas\n\n### Oil & Gas\n\nWe have the parts from bearings and seals to fluid power to drilling tools to help you maintain the flexibility needed to meet the demands of this critical industry.](/cms/industry/oil-gas-extraction)[Pulp & Paper\n\n### Pulp & Paper\n\nOur reliable products, from power transmission components to driveshafts to gearing, keep pace with the large production volume this industry requires to operate.](/cms/industry/pulp-paper)[Rubber & Plastics\n\n### Rubber & Plastics\n\nFrom motion controls to hydraulics to conveyor solutions, we have the products to support your production needs, as well as automated solutions to support innovations such as 3D printing.](/cms/industry/rubber-plastics)[Semiconductor\n\n### Semiconductor\n\nMotion is your industry partner for competitiveness. We lead the industry by providing high-quality components for leading semiconductor manufacturers.](/cms/industry/semiconductor)[Water Treatment\n\n### Water Treatment\n\nDiscover products and services to support water and wastewater treatment plants in maintaining sustainable, safe, and efficient operations. Our inventory includes various pumps, meters, compressors, blowers, testing equipment, gaskets, seals, and more.](/cms/industry/waterworks)\n\n## Services we offer\n\n[Automation\n\n### Automation\n\nWe provide product selection, sizing and configuration, technical support, and application engineering services customized for your automation needs.](https://ai.motion.com/)[Conveyance\n\n### Conveyance\n\nWe specialize in both heavy and light weight belting solutions, providing maintenance, repair, and installation of conveyor belts in various industries such as mining, construction, and manufacturing.](https://www.miconveyancesolutions.com/)[Fluid Power\n\n### Fluid Power\n\nGet MORE of the hydraulic & pneumatic parts and services you need. MORE products in stock when you need them, MORE experts to help you find the solutions, and MORE locations to ensure the fluid power parts you need are always close at hand.](https://mifluidpowersolutions.com/)[Repair & Services\n\n### Repair & Services\n\nWe meet your needs for the build, repair, and supply of universal joints, shaft assemblies, and hydraulic and pneumatic components.](https://mirepairandservices.com/)[Onsite Solutions\n\n### Onsite Solutions\n\nOur comprehensive program of onsite people, services, technology, and storeroom solutions allows for accurate point-of-use and storeroom inventory management and cost savings opportunities.](/cms/onsite-solutions)[Energy Services\n\n### Energy Services\n\nWe recommend the most efficient sustainable energy solutions for your plant and budgetary goals based on our on-site assessments to evaluate compressed air, steam, electrical and mechanical systems, and lighting.](/cms/onsite-solutions/energy-services)[Hands-on & Online Training\n\n### Hands-on & Online Training\n\nWe offer a wide variety of courses of instruction and can design a custom course for your needs. Learning center, in-plant, and online training classes are available.](/cms/learning-and-development)[Safety Services\n\n### Safety Services\n\nOur qualified specialists work with your EHS and Plant Managers to evaluate current safety products and procedures, eliminate hazards, and make recommendations that ensure your facility meets the standards for safe working conditions.](/cms/about-us)\n\n## Quick Facts\n\nSince 1976, Motion has been a subsidiary of [Genuine Parts Company (NYSE:GPC)](https://www.genpt.com)\n\n* 600+\n\n  Locations in North America\n* 17\n\n  Distribution Centers\n* $8.2\n\n  Billion in Annual Sales (2024)\n* 77\n\n  Repair and Service Centers\n\n## Vision\n\nContinually earn our place as the premier industrial solutions company by:\n\n* Providing the preferred customer experience\n* Energizing our talent\n* Delivering stakeholder value\n\n## Values\n\n* Fair\n* Ethical\n* Inclusive\n* Invested\n\n## Our Story\n\n### 1946\n\nOwen-Richards Company purchased by Caldwell Marks & William Spencer in Birmingham, Alabama\nFirst year sales exceed $500,000\n\n### 1954\n\nOwen-Richards Company begins $150,000 warehouse expansion\n\n### 1970\n\nBearings & Transmission Supply (BATS) & Owen-Richards Company merge to form Motion Industries\n\n### 1976\n\nMotion Industries becomes a wholly owned subsidiary of Genuine Parts Company (GPC)\nNew 30,000 SF Headquarters completed in Irondale, Alabama\n\n### 1983\n\n\"Keeping Industry in Motion\" adopted as official slogan\n\n### 1984\n\nMichael S. Gaffney named President/CEO\n\n### 1988\n\nMi Learning & Development opens first training center\n\n### 1994\n\nMotion Industries expands into Canada with Oliver Industrial Supply\nSales exceed $1billion\n\n### 1997\n\nWilliam J. Stevens namedPresident/CEO\n\n### 2000\n\nwww.MotionMro.com launches, the first transactional website for Mi\n\n### 2006\n\nOver 500 locations in North America\nSales of $3.1billion\n\n### 2008\n\nwww.MotionIndustries.com launches\n\n### 2012\n\nMiHow2, new video series launches\n\n### 2014\n\nTimothy P. Breen named President/CEO\n\n### 2018\n\nRandall (Randy) P. Breaux named President – North America\nSales reach $6 billion\n\n### 2020\n\nCompleted Headquarters renovation in Irondale, Alabama\nInenco becomes Motion Asia Pacific\n\n### 2021\n\nMotion unveils new logo and branding to celebrate 75 years\nMotion’s first Market Distribution Center opens in Lakeland, FL\n\n### 2024\n\nJames Howe named President – North America\n\n## Environmental, social, and governance (ESG)\n\nWe are committed to operating our business with integrity – contributing our time, talent, and resources to supporting our local communities, promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace, and being thoughtful stewards of our environment and natural resources. Our goal is to achieve positive impact that matters – to society and to the planet.\n\nOur integrated approach to our strategy, corporate governance, and social and environmental responsibility creates long-term value for our employees, our suppliers, our customers, our communities, and our GPC shareholders. We encourage the Motion family of employees to participate in community activities, both through company-organized events and individually; we also offer compensatory time for their volunteer work. Learn more at [motionesg.com](https://www.motionesg.com/).\n\n## Products we offer\n\n* [Abrasives](/products/Abrasives)\n* [Adhesives, Sealants and Tape](/products/Adhesives%2C%20Sealants%20and%20Tape)\n* [Bearings](/products/Bearings)\n* [Chemicals, Lubricants and Equipment](/products/Chemicals%2C%20Lubricants%20and%20Equipment)\n* [Cutting Tools](/products/Cutting%20Tools)\n* [Electrical](/products/Electrical)\n* [Facility Maintenance](/products/Facility%20Maintenance)\n* [Hose and Fittings](/products/Hose%20and%20Fittings)\n* [Hydraulics](/products/Hydraulics)\n* [Janitorial](/products/Janitorial)\n* [Linear Motion](/products/Linear%20Motion)\n* [Material Handling](/products/Material%20Handling)\n* [Mechanical Power Transmission](/products/Mechanical%20Power%20Transmission)\n* [Pneumatics](/products/Pneumatics)\n* [Process Pumps and Equipment](/products/Process%20Pumps%20and%20Equipment)\n* [Raw Materials](/products/Raw%20Materials)\n* [Safety](/products/Safety)\n* [Seals and Gaskets](/products/Seals%20and%20Gaskets)\n* [Tools and Testing Instruments](/products/Tools%20and%20Testing%20Instruments)\n\nThis website uses cookies and other tracking technologies to enhance user experience, to display personalized advertisements and to analyze performance and traffic on our website. fees.\n\nHave an account?[Login](/login)\n\n* [Home](/)/\n* Our Company\n\nAirgas continues to be a trusted collaborator for customers nationwide in all the markets we serve.\n\n\n\n\n## Always at the forefront\n\nAirgas, an Air Liquide company, is a leading U.S. supplier of industrial, medical and specialty gases, as well as hardgoods and related products; one of the largest U.S. suppliers of safety products; and a leading U.S. supplier of ammonia products and process chemicals.\n\n### Airgas Profile\n\nLearn more about Airgas now.  \n[Access the Airgas Profile](/CO-01%20Airgas-Corporate-Profile-2022)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAirgas helps more than 1 million customers advance their business performance and reach\ntheir full potential with reliable products, services and expertise used to create, build, care,\nserve and sustain.\n\nAs an [Air Liquide](https://www.airliquide.com/group/united-states-america) company, a world leader in gases, technology and services for Industry and Health, Airgas offers customers an unrivaled global footprint and industry-leading technology and innovations.\n\n## History\n\nAirgas was founded in 1982 with the acquisition of a local distributor, Connecticut Oxygen. The company has grown organically and through more than 520 acquisitions to become the largest U.S. distribution network in the packaged gas industry. Airgas was acquired by Air Liquide in 2016. Together, the combined company became a world leader in gas and services for Industry and Health.\n\n## Acting for all\n\nLearn more about our [Sustainability](/sustainability-corporate-responsibility) and [Diversity + Inclusion](/diversity-inclusion) efforts.\n\nKnow MORE\n\nAirgas Distribution Map\n\n\n\n\n\n## Robust supply chain\n\nWith a comprehensive supply chain and unrivaled nationwide footprint, Airgas ensures that customers have the gases and supplies they need, when and where they need them.\n\nAirgas’ extensive supply chain network reliably provides products and services all over the country. With more than 1,400 locations nationwide — including branches, fill plants, specialty gas labs and production sites — along with the support of Air Liquide and relationships with suppliers, Airgas is able to get customers what they need, when they need it. Various modes of distribution and supply chain redundancy maximize Airgas’ reliability while minimizing risk for customers.\n\n## The unique value of an Airgas relationship\n\nDelivering more than products and insights, Airgas provides the components to help customers achieve greater possibilities while continually contributing to their growth.\n\nAirgas provides personal, attentive, and helpful service everywhere customers are located. Customers can interact and transact with Airgas in the way that best meets their needs: online, in store, or on the phone, anytime and anywhere. This includes a network of 900+ Airgas retail locations, the Airgas.com eBusiness platform, and a team of expert Airgas Total Access® telesales representatives. Building solutions together, we help customers increase quality, unlock greater competitiveness and improve the safety and sustainability of their activities.\n\nFormed through acquisition and strategic organic growth over the past four decades and now part of the Air Liquide Group, Airgas is present in all 50 states. Our national footprint is combined with a regional structure that keeps service close to local customers.\n\n## Serving diverse industries\n\nDedicated to improving the performance of its more than one million customers, Airgas safely and reliably provides products, services and expertise to the following industries through more than 18,000 associates, over 1,400 locations, robust eBusiness platform and Airgas Total Access® telesales channel:\n\n* Construction\n* Energy and chemicals\n* Food and beverage\n* Government, defense and aerospace\n* Life sciences\n\n* Healthcare\n* Manufacturing and metal fabrication\n* Power and utilities\n* Metals\n* Retail services\n\n* Construction\n* Energy and chemicals\n* Food and beverage\n* Government, defense and aerospace\n* Life sciences\n* Healthcare\n* Manufacturing and metal fabrication\n* Power and utilities\n* Metals\n* Retail services\n\n## Trusted locally nationwide\n\nAirgas provides personal, attentive and helpful service everywhere customers are located.\n\nCustomers can interact and transact with Airgas in the way that best meets their needs: online, in store, or on the phone, anytime and anywhere. This includes a network of 900+ Airgas retail branches, the Airgas.com eBusiness platform and a team of expert Airgas Total Access telesales representatives.\n\n## Committed to safety\n\nAirgas’ top priority and core value is the safety of our associates, customers, and the communities in which we operate.\n\nThe Airgas Safety Program is rooted in the belief that you must know your hazards before you can control them. With detailed safety policies and training, Airgas empowers each associate with the knowledge and skills to safely perform their jobs and to identify and correct unsafe work practices. Annually, all Airgas associates pledge their commitment to Airgas’ safety policies and procedures. Safety extends beyond our plants and branches. With nearly 6,000 vehicles in its fleet, Airgas remains steadfastly focused on maintaining a safe driving record. Through rigorous training and commitment to safety by our drivers, Airgas continually achieves one of the lowest accident rates in the industry.\n\nAirgas operates the largest U.S. hazmat organization specifically trained to handle compressed gases, the Airgas Emergency Response Organization (AERO). Specially trained AERO teams located throughout the country respond quickly to emergencies that arise in the communities in which Airgas operates.\n\n008CBAF8B6418EDEB2FB8689FFACEC5C\n\n\n\n\n---\n\nGas Supply\n\n* [Airgas Dry Ice](Https://www.airgas.com/services/packaged-gas-supply/dry-ice \"Airgas Dry Ice\")\n* [Bulk Gas Report](https://s23.q4cdn.com/591718779/files/doc_downloads/2025/05/Exhibit-1-01-Conflict-Minerals-Report-2024-5-14-R5_no-Footers.pdf)\n\nAbout Fastenal\n--------------\n\nFastenal is different things to different customers: a local relationship, a logistics company, a consultant, a technology solutions provider, and more generally, a distributor of wide-ranging industrial and construction products. These aspects of our service share a common foundation: great people, close to our customers, backed by world-class resources. As our capabilities continue to expand and evolve, this is what sets us apart in terms of service, growth, and value.\n\n‘Great people’ speaks to our organizational commitment to bring out and fully utilize the creativity of every team member. We pursue this by prioritizing employee training, by rewarding success and promoting from within, and by maintaining a decentralized culture where ideas and innovation flow in all directions, not just from the top down.\n\n‘Close to our customers’ refers to our local distribution infrastructure – the hubs, trucks, in-market servicing locations, and point-of-use solutions that shorten and simplify the supply chain. It also refers to something less tangible (but closely related) – the customer relationships, collaboration, and strategic alignment afforded by our local presence.\n\n‘World-class resources’ describes the ever-expanding suite of products, services, solutions, and specialists we draw upon to meet each customer’s unique business needs. With offerings that range from custom manufacturing, to subject matter experts in areas like safety and engineering, to e-business and automated supply solutions, we provide value far beyond selling and shipping products.\n\nIn an industry that’s becoming increasingly centralized, standardized, and transactional, we’re growing faster – and more profitably – by continuing to invest in the fundamentals of effective service: great people, close to our customers, backed by world-class resources.\n\n[](https://www.fastenal.com/en/3/about-us;jsessionid=DCkCtLoWWGj1p1XbMUiPIk7J.713728dc-d653-355a-a89c-3e45dac6e990?intcmp=ft-about_us)[](https://www.fastenal.com/fast/about-us)\n\nLatest All rights reserved.\n3 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Continued on next page 2024: The Calm Before the Tariff Storm Welcome to Modern Distribution Management’s 2025 Top Distributors feature, now in its 16th year. Here, you’ll find our rankings of North America’s largest distributors of industrial, commercial and building supply products, based on their 2024 fiscal revenue within 20 different industry verticals. More than 200 different companies are represented across these various lists.\nIt’s MDM’s biggest research project of the year.\nBefore you dive into our rankings in the pages ahead, I want to set the stage for the key factors that shaped this year’s feature and the context you should know when perusing our lists.\nA One-Year “Normalcy” Reprieve Since our lists are based purely on 2024 fiscal revenue for all distributors, that year is worth examining from a high level.\nAfter riding the inflation wave in 2021 and 2022, distributors saw that tailwind weaken throughout 2023, and it was essentially a non-factor in 2024. Year-over-year comparables finally leveled off in 2024, and in a way, that made it feel like the first “normal” year for wholesale distribution financials for the first time since 2019 with no one single factor heavily influencing figures broadly.\nHeading into 2024, analysts had predicted a palpable industrial supply demand slowdown, and that forecast pushed further and further into the year and never really materialized aside from pockets of it. However, demand expectedly slowed in the fourth quarter as the U.S. general election loomed and President Trump’s election infused rampant economic uncertainty over how his administration’s trade policies would play out. 2025 has been anything but normal.\nU.S. wholesale distribution revenue finished at $8.076 trillion — a new annual record for the industry — up 2.0% compared with 2023. That’s not a gangbusters year by any means, and it trailed U.S. GDP annual growth of 2.8%, but it was within the long-run average of modest growth. Exemplifying distribution’s fragmentation and diversity, certain industry sectors saw excellent 2024 growth (electrical & electronics +11.4%; pharmaceutical +8.2%), while others saw considerable decline (agricultur-al -12.1%; metal service centers -10.1%). The vast majority of the distributors on our lists in the pages ahead posted annual sales gains in 2024, and tariff-driven market uncertainly led to inventory front-loading during 1Q25 as manufacturers and distribu-tors looked to stockpile goods before higher import levies took effect. As of mid-May, MDM expects overall, annual industry revenue to increase 3.3% in 2025, followed by stronger 4.6% growth in 2026.\nIndustry-Specific Revenue Like for the past several years, this is the most import-ant part of this introduction. Starting in 2022, MDM put a heightened emphasis on ranking companies by their sector-specific revenues rather than total revenue.\nThis also explains why you’ll see some distributors with smaller total revenues ranked higher than others within the same industry.\nTake Grainger, for example. By its total 2024 revenue of $17.2 billion, Grainger is North America’s largest indus-trial supplies distributor. But when digging into its finan-cial reports and product sector breakouts, we find that it’s also one of North America’s top distributors of electrical, HVACR, plumbing, power transmission, fluid power and safety products. This is why Grainger appears on 10 of our 20 sector lists — the company’s revenue within each of those segments is large enough to warrant a spot. And this is why Watsco is ranked No. 1 in HVACR and Grainger is No. 5. Despite Watsco’s $7.6 billion revenue being much smaller than Grainger’s — Watsco’s HVACR revenue was much higher than Grainger’s.\nThis explains why you’ll find some companies chart-ed on industry lists outside of their “core” offering. For example, Graybar is best known as an electrical products distributor, but its industrial products sales were large enough to chart at No. 14 on our Industrial Supplies list. It’s also why Ferguson appears on our lists for Industrial Supplies, Building Materials/Construction and Safety, besides its hallmarks of Plumbing, HVACR and Industrial PVF.\nBut while our rankings are based on 2024 revenue within each sector, the revenue you see displayed on our lists is overall revenue. Why? Quite simply, while many Source: MDM Forecast MDM Forecast: U.S. Wholesale Distribution Revenue by Year © 2025 Modern Distribution Management. All rights reserved.\n4 research 2025 MDM Top Distributors Lists Latest updates at mdm.com/top_distributors Site licenses and multi-user pricing are available for those who wish to access Modern Distribution Management Premium content. Contact us for details at info@mdm.com, call (202) 872-0885 or visit our website at www.mdm.com.\nresearch Mike Hockett, Executive Editor Vesna Brajkovic, Senior Editor Tish Drake, SVP, MDM Portfolio Management Hadley Fable, VP, Operations MDM privately-owned distributors elected not to publicly share their total revenues, far fewer elected not to publicly share their sector-specific revenues. If we displayed the sector-specific revenues of those that gave us the OK to, they’d be few and far between. The overall revenue figure gives us something to show for the majority of companies on our lists.\nThat sector-specific revenue breakout is the most painstaking part of our research process, as it involves an incredible amount of hair-splitting and triangulation to find accurate revenues. It makes this feature all the more challenging, but we do it because it results in a more accu-rate list and levels the playing field.\nOur Research Process & Methodology MDM’s Top Distributors Lists were based on 2024 fiscal revenues within industry sectors, either reported or estimated by MDM’s editorial team and sector validators. For distributors that don’t follow a January-December fiscal calendar, we’ve noted that with an asterisk and a footnote. To normalize the way we display the rankings, we include total company revenues, rather than breaking out individual sector revenues. Companies were asked to provide data about revenue, with information sup-plemented by quarterly fiscal reports, SEC filings and publicly available information. For companies that elect to not share revenue data, MDM estimates their relative po-sition in its sector list based on the best available industry resources and information. Note: Companies that operate primarily as master distributors are not eligible for Top Distributors inclusion.\nTwo Core Lists Expanded With the help of our key validation sources and sup-port from MDM’s integration into the National Associa-tion of Wholesaler-Distributors, we were able to expand two of our biggest lists — Electrical/Data/Security and Building Materials/Construction — showing a larger rep-resentation of those sectors than ever before. Electrical/ Data/Security now shows the top 40 companies (up from 30 in 2024) and Building Materials/Construction numbers out to 20 (up from 15 in 2024).\nWhere's Amazon Business?\nMDM readers who have regularly seen our Top Distributors lists over the years may notice that we don’t include the industry’s biggest elephant in the room: Amazon Business. The B2B supplies marketplace appeared in the top six of our Top Industrial list since first appearing in 2018, including at No. 2 in 2022. But while the platform is certainly competing directly with indus-trial, commercial and building supply distributors for market share to a tune of $35 billion in 2022 revenue, we made the decision in 2023 to omit it from our lists due to Amazon Business’ very unique business model. It was the only company on our lists in previous years that couldn’t be described as a distributor. We do, however, include The Home Depot’s Pro component, which directly operates via distribution sales, services and logistics. To Keep in Mind As you peruse our rankings across these different verticals, it’s important to remember that the way we put them together is not an exact science. Our editorial team made every effort to extract revenue information from the non-publicly-traded distributors listed here, but many companies are understandably private with that information. We are happy to keep their revenue strictly private and only use it internally for rankings, which a number of companies opt for each year. So, when you see “N/A” listed for revenue, that likely means that revenue figure was confidentially given to MDM and to not be published.\nEven with that understanding, a smaller number of companies would rather not budge on sharing their revenue at all. Given the amount of large distributors that have been privately-acquired in recent years, this isn’t a surprise. In these cases where revenue isn’t shared, our team triangulates with respected industry experts and the best available information to estimate and rank distribu-tors appropriately.\nAnother nugget to note is that since we used fiscal 2024 revenue for all companies, the revenue of a handful of companies that don’t follow a traditional 12-month fiscal calendar represent a time difference by as much as nine months. We’ve denoted distributors that don’t follow a traditional fiscal calendar with an asterisk next to their revenue and a footnote for that.\nQuestions? Comments?\nAs alluded to above, there is no perfect way to conduct these rankings. I’m sure there are MDM readers who will disagree with where and how certain companies are slotted on our list, and that’s OK, especially given our focus on sector-specific revenue. I’m very open to comments and suggestions for how we can improve this feature going forward. Don’t hesitate to reach out.\nMike Hockett Executive Editor Modern Distribution Management © 2025 Modern Distribution Management. Fast forward one year, and the 2023 numbers are in: did distributors fare as well?\n\n**WATCH OUR BIG 50 COUNTDOWN VIDEOS: [Part 1: 50-31](https://www.inddist.com/video/video/22921172/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-5031), [Part 2: 30-11](https://www.inddist.com/video/video/22921285/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-3011), [Part 3: 10-1](https://www.inddist.com/big-50/video/22921433/the-2024-industrial-distribution-big-50-countdown-the-top-10)**\n\nIt’s clear that the Big 50 List this year, in which we rank industrial distributors based on their 2023 performances, is a bit more varied. Many maneuvered through uneven end markets: costs continued to rise, while customers reached a breaking point on price increases.\n\nThe escalator may have stopped, but there was still a set of stairs to climb. We saw many companies incrementally grow, with a few who actually blew 2022 out of the water. Perhaps most importantly, we saw just a handful of them go backwards.\n\nTellingly, the companies on our Big 50 List are moving forward despite any short-term roadblocks they may have encountered last year. Instead of retreating with the soft categories that supported them, we heard from many a story of growth: heavy acquisition activity, product line expansions, new branches, executive hires – all the things that change the tenor to create the exact right kind of “humming along” for each business.\n\nAlthough many saw big years without major acquisitions, dozens of other distributors on this year’s list have also been active on the mergers and acquisitions front — with some exciting developments that will alter the shape of Big 50 lists to come.\n\nPresenting the 2024 Industrial Distribution Big 50:\n\n| **The 2024 *Industrial Distribution*****Big 50** | | | | | | |\n| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |\n|  |  |  | **2023 Sales** | **Top Executive** |  |  |\n|  | [W.W. We provide a myriad of solutions including on-site, repair, automation, conveyance, and more.\n\n[Discover More About Us](/cms/about-us)\n\n### More Safety\n\nFor industrial-grade safety products from top brands, browse Motion’s collection of protective equipment, first aid products, braces, supports, anti-slip tape, treads, and more.\n\n[Shop Safety](/products/Safety)\n\n## Shop Trusted Brands\n\n[Shop by Brand](/products/brand-list)\n\n## DISCOVER WATER TREATMENT\n\nSOLUTIONS\n\n[Shop Now](/cms/industry/waterworks)\n\n## HIGH-QUALITY PRODUCTS\n\nUNMATCHED SERVICE\n\n[Shop Now](/products/brands/skf)\n\nThis website uses cookies and other tracking technologies to enhance user experience, to display personalized advertisements and to analyze performance and traffic on our website. We also share information about your use of our site with our social media, advertising and analytics partners. You can find out additional information by clicking the Cookie Categories Button.\n\n## Cookie Privacy Center\n\nWhen you visit our website, we store cookies on your browser to collect information. The information collected might relate to you, your preferences or your device, and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to and to provide a more personalized web experience. Click on the different category headings to learn about the different categories of cookies we collect.\n\n### Manage Consent Preferences\n\n#### Strictly Necessary Cookies\n\nThese cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.    You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.\n\n#### Functional Cookies\n\nThese cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.    If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.\n\n#### Targeting Cookies\n\nThese cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.    They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.\n\n#### Performance Cookies\n\nThese cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site.    All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous.
